definition[0]: happening or existing in connection with something else that is more important
example[0]: Increased motivation is more than an incidental benefit of reward schemes.
example[1]: companies that carry out investment business that is incidental to their main activity
definition[1]: naturally happening as a result of something
example[2]: Drinking too much is almost incidental to bartending.
definition[2]: something that you have to do, buy etc which you had not planned to
example[3]: Carry extra cash for taxis, tips, and other incidentals.
definition[3]: small amounts of money which are spent at various times as part of a larger bill
example[4]: The Law Centre has to meet the incidental expenses of the committee, such as phone bills, petrol and stationery.
